questions: Q. 9. A ray of light travelling in air enters obliquely into water. Does the light ray bend towards the normal or away from the normal ? Why ?
answers: Ans. The light ray bends towards the normal when a ray of light travels from an optically rarer medium to an optically denser medium. Since water is optically denser than air, a ray of light travelling from air into water will bend towards the normal.
